page.title: 10FARMING IN IDRIDGEHAY
page.content: In Idridgehay high rainfall makes grass grow well.The grass is eaten by cows.In summer we cut the grass for silage and hay for winter feed.In summer farmers strip graze.Strip grazing makes the cows eat grass economically.The farmers divide the field with a movable electric fence. When the cows have eaten the grass in one area the electric fence is moved to let them into another part of the field.The cows are mainly for milk. Some people in Idridgehay faten cows for meat.Most people in Idridgehay have modern milking parlours.The milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board. This year the price is l5p a litre. Recently farmers have started growing potatoes, barley and wheat.This is to conform with the European Economic Communities' plan to reduce milk production.
